name: Cape Barren Goose
description: It is ashy gray with darker wing markings and a white forehead. Its beak is light yellowish-green with a black tip, and its legs are red.
food_note: Grass and, to a lesser extent, seeds
image_alt: Cape Barren goose, photo: Richard Taylor
proportions: Length 75–100 cm; wing length 34.5–45 cm; weight 3.1–6.8 kg
reproduction: Females lay 3–6 eggs; incubation lasts 35 days.
attractions: The Cape Barren goose prefers life on land, entering water only rarely—during chick-rearing or molting. It nests during the Australian winter, from June to August.
breeding: Records of its keeping are unfortunately incomplete. Though kept at the zoo in the 1960s, consistent data begins only in 1981.
